meanings.definition: The study of lines connecting points of equal magnetic intensity.
meanings.sent1: In isogonics, scientists analyze lines that link areas with the same magnetic strength.
meanings.sent2: The map displayed detailed isogonics showing regions with identical magnetic intensity.
meanings.sent3: During the isogonics class, the students drew lines connecting spots with matching magnetic power.
meanings.sent4: The isogonics of the map resembled a spider web, connecting points of equal magnetic intensity.
meanings.sent5: The concept of isogonics helps us understand how magnetic fields vary across different locations.

meanings.definition: A line connecting points of equal magnetic intensity.
meanings.sent1: The isogonics on the map indicated areas with the same magnetic strength.
meanings.sent2: She followed the isogonics to navigate through regions with equal magnetic intensity.
meanings.sent3: The isogonics on the graph looked like a colorful maze of magnetic connections.
meanings.sent4: The isogonics acted as a guide, leading us to spots with matching magnetic power.
meanings.sent5: The isogonics intersected at a point where the magnetic intensity was the highest.

meanings.definition: The science or study of lines connecting points of equal magnetic intensity.
meanings.sent1: Studying isogonics involves analyzing lines that connect areas with the same magnetic strength.
meanings.sent2: The researchers delved into the field of isogonics to understand magnetic intensity patterns.
meanings.sent3: The isogonics research team discovered a new method to map magnetic fields accurately.
meanings.sent4: The isogonics experts used advanced technology to study magnetic intensity variations.
meanings.sent5: Learning about isogonics helps us comprehend the distribution of magnetic intensity across regions.
